title: Experience Strategy Director
content:
Are you the kind of strategist that wants to create enormous impact on some of the biggest, and most famous brands in the world?
Do you want to build your career in an agency that has been named Network of the year for both creativity and effectiveness? 
Do you look out and above your discipline, and resist the desire to stay in your lane?
Are you a well all-rounded strategist with strong knowledge of how brands grow in the Social & Digital Age that you use to drive transformative work?
If so, read on.
A bit about Ogilvy. 
You’ve heard of us and you know some our famous campaigns. But do you know how we work, and what makes us different?
Most importantly, we don’t just create advertising ideas, we create ideas that impact how consumers see and navigate through their world. We achieve this by breaking down the barriers and working fluidly between the engines of modern marketing today: Advertising, Consulting, Experience, PR and I, and Health.
We call this Borderless Creativity.  Ogilvy scales this by seamlessly connecting and accessing the deep and diverse cultural expertise of 132 offices in 83 countries and in a way that celebrates our commitment to diversity, equity and. inclusion. 
About This RoleThis is a role across some of the most iconic brands around within The Coca-Cola Company: Sprite and Fanta. The role sits in the bespoke model created to the needs of these brands: WPP ‘Open X’. Whilst you will be employed by Ogilvy and sit in the heart of a welcoming, feisty and fun planning community in London’s Sea Containers House, you will work closely and collaborate with wider WPP teams from David, VML, Wavemaker and EssenceMediacom across continents.What the role entails

Support the Strategic Leads on the global strategy development for Sprite and Fanta
Bring to life the new brand platform through localisation and activation across the E2E ecosystem for value-exchange, behaviour driving work
Take ownership in the development of thinking across a selection of new briefs for campaigns bringing the new brand platforms to life for consumers
Lead the necessary research to identify driving insights for creative briefs that lead to increasingly ground-breaking work for Sprite and Fanta, two of the Coca-Cola’s biggest brands and creative opportunities. 
Integrate thinking with the Global Engagement Strategy to deliver strategy across Advertising, Brand, Content (ABC) and Experience to deliver connected E2E CX
Connect the new platform to the audience passion points, with focus on gaming, requiring a heavy focus on culture and experiential.

In Terms Of The Skills We Are Looking For

Very strong strategic thinker who enjoys grappling with brand foundations and is able to capture the essence of brands in simple, persuasive language.
Confident discussing business issues and understand how brands grow.
You need to be data literate and able to understand client’s business results and issues, as well as having experience of writing effectiveness case studies.
You will sometimes be pulled into strategy conversations for other markets at short notice, so the ability to think both clearly and quickly is key.
You will enjoy writing strategic briefs and presentations and be a skilled verbal and visual communicator.
You will enjoy the creative process and be skilled at helping shape/champion creative ideas, making sure they are on brand strategy.
You don’t need to be a digital expert, but many briefs will be digital-first, so you will need to bring linked up cross-channel thinking.
You need to build relationships with internal stakeholders and clients and be confident about leading conversations and addressing tricky sticking points.
Experience of working on global or pan-market brands would be a strong advantage; at the least, we expect you to have strong curiosity about other markets and the desire to immerse yourself strategically in other cultures.
An interest in FMGC (especially food and beverage) would also be advantageous (although experience is not essential).
It’s a busy account, so you will need to be able to work alone on some projects owning workstreams from start to finish; as well as planning the overall approach, you should be great at managing your time effectively and demonstrate attention to detail.
You should be a strong and respectful collaborator and enjoy working alongside colleagues from behavioural science, digital strategy etc.

What can you expect from us? This is a role where you have the opportunity to make career defining work whilst working alongside agency talent and clients who are at the very top of their game. Beyond career development, Ogilvy offers a great fun and fulfilling working environment with a strong community and a lack of silos. You’ll be part of a tight-knit team of people willing to go out of their way for each other and you’ll get guidance and full support from senior leadership team members.Our learning and development team are on hand to provide training for you, to help you excel in every aspect of your role. So, if you think you may not have experience in some aspects of this position, don’t worry, and apply away. We’re here to help you grow and nurture your skills.How we help you thrive

25 days annual leave + 1 Volunteer Day
Bupa Healthcare (includes Bupa health assessment and menopause support)
Enhanced Maternity, Adoption and Shared Parental leave
We have a flexible working policy with core working hours (10am – 4pm) and have launched our 3.2 Hybrid Working model
A 1.5:1 matching pension structure
Wellbeing and Health: Up to £25.00 per month towards physical or online exercise class membership, Unmind membership, LifeWorks tool and annual eye tests. 
Learning and development budgets plus Enhanced and ongoing wellbeing incentives and activities throughout the year
Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme 
Life Assurance x4 salary 
Inclusion@Ogilvy: To foster an inclusive environment we have our internal groups: Ogilvy Rewired, Roots, Equals, Proud plus Parents and Carers. See here for more information 



At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

demographic_questions.description:
At Ogilvy we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and equal opportunities employer. We believe in creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity, equity and inclusion.  We strive to recruit from a diverse range of candidates and create an environment which provides the right conditions for belonging. We welcome all applications regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, marital status, , sexual orientation and physical or mental disability etc. (please note this is not an exhaustive list). We are also actively focussed on encouraging greater representation by bringing more under-represented talent into our organisation. This is hugely important to us and Ogilvy has a thriving network of employee communities that exist to help everyone, no matter their background, succeed here.

In order to help us achieve this and hold ourselves accountable for progress and monitor our efforts, we invite you to answer the following questions. You are not required to answer any of them, as they are entirely voluntary. They will also not be viewable to those interviewing you as part of your application or candidate profile. If you choose to answer, please know that all data is stored separately, used in aggregate for reporting purposes and handled as per GDPR regulations.
